This turn result increase rate unplanned cesarean delivery ( CD ) result fail induction labor ( IOL ) , arrest disorder non-reassuring fetal heart rate tracing , dose-dependent increase class obesity . DOC.brief_title: Cervical Ripening Obese Women : A Randomized , Comparative Effectiveness Trial
DOC.detailed_description: Nulliparous pregnant woman ≥ 32 week ' gestation admit labor delivery IOL meet inclusion exclusion criterion approach research staff . Group 1 compose woman allocate Foley balloon plus misoprostol . These woman receive vaginal misoprostol per standard protocol 25 microgram every 4 hour . In addition , 26 Fr-Foley balloon catheter insert routine clinical standard . The Foley insert internal cervical o , fill 60 mL normal saline , pull snugly internal o . The catheter Foley tap patient 's inner thigh gentle traction . If Foley unable place , patient reexamine 1 hour placement reattempted Bishop 's score still 6 less healthcare provider . When Foley balloon fall remove 12 hour pass since insertion per protocol , management labor leave discretion labor team . Group 2 compose woman allocate vaginal misoprostol-only . These woman receive 25 microgram misoprostol per vagina every 4 hour . Once cervix becomes favorable ( Bishop score > 6 ) , misoprostol administration discontinue . Similarly , management leave discretion labor team . In group , IV oxytocin indicate , withhold 4 hour last dose misoprostol prevent uterine hyperstimulation . Other aspect labor management similar group , include continuous electronic fetal monitoring external Doppler device fetal scalp electrode . Uterine contraction assessment perform either external tocodynamometer intrauterine pressure catheter .
DOC.criteria: Inclusion Criteria Nulliparous woman age 18 BMI ≥ 30 time labor induction Singleton gestation Cephalic presentation ( include successful external cephalic version ) Intact fetal membrane Unfavorable cervix ( Bishop score ≤ 6 ) Gestational age ≥ 32 week Exclusion Criteria Patient candidate IOL misoprostol deem treat physician Multiple gestation Major fetal anomaly Fetal demise
